subject: Leadership
title: Mental Models
description: Learn Mental Models in one minute.

hook.text: Two leaders look at the same data. One sees a threat, the other an opportunity. Data didn't change. Their lenses did.

buildup.text: Mental models are frameworks the brain uses to interpret reality. They simplify complexity but can also distort it.

discovery.text: Munger: 'You must have multiple models. If you have just one, you'll torture reality to fit it.' Collect diverse lenses.

twist.text: The model you rely on most is the one you're least likely to question. Familiarity breeds blind spots, not clarity.

climax.text: Build a latticework: combine models from psychology, economics, biology, and history. Better models, better decisions.

punchline.text: The quality of your thinking depends on the models in your head.

quiz.question: Why should leaders use multiple mental models?
options: Multiple models prevent distorting reality to fit one
